title: Higher-order compact finite difference scheme
summary: High-order compact finite difference schemes are used for solving third-order differential equations created during the study of obstacle boundary value problems. They have been shown to be highly accurate and efficient. They are constructed by modifying the second-order scheme that was developed by Noor and Al-Said in 2002. The convergence rate of the high-order compact scheme is third order, the second-order scheme is fourth order.[1]
